Is this expected?

set_option autoImplicit true

-- no error
def a : x := sorry

-- unknown identifier `x`
axiom b : x
Sorry for going off topic, but I'm just curious, what are people using axiom for?

If you use the live lean link (which currently is Lean 4.21.0) it works.

I don't remember exactly when this was fixed, but it was within the last few months or so.

Thomas Zhu has marked this topic as resolved.

Kenny Lau said:

Sorry for going off topic, but I'm just curious, what are people using axiom for?

I use it when I want to make sure that "this is the last unproved lemma that my theorem depends on".
I also used it when I was trying to mimic other proof systems.

I'm using it for a similar reason to Martin for FLT. I think FLT will first turn into "FLT follows from a bunch of axioms and a bunch of sorrys and I will claim that all the sorries can be filled with mathematics which was known in the 1980s" and then later on into "FLT follows from about 10 axioms each of which can be checked to have a clear reference from the 1980s"

Kenny Lau schrieb:

Sorry for going off topic, but I'm just curious, what are people using axiom for?

I use it for #mwe and test cases, often starting with

axiom testSorry : α

so that I don’t get annoying warnings from uses of sorry (at least until we can turn the warning off)
I think I would use sorry for these cases.

Kenny Lau said:

I think I would use sorry for these cases.

I think the reason for not using sorry is that #print axioms can show the names of unfinished lemmas (claimed as axioms) instead of showing a generic sorryAx
